intro: Polylepis boyacensis, commonly known as the Boyacá polylepis, is a species of tree native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often multi-stemmed growth habit. The tree produces small, white flowers and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a leathery texture. Polylepis boyacensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat for various endemic species.
